Literature.Title: Micrococcin P1 - A bactericidal thiopeptide active against Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
Literature.Author: Degiacomi G, Personne Y, Mondésert G, Ge X, Mandava CS, Hartkoorn RC, Boldrin F, Goel P, Peisker K, Benjak A, Barrio MB, Ventura M, Brown AC, Leblanc V, Bauer A, Sanyal S, Cole ST, Lagrange S, Parish T, Manganelli R

Literature.Author: Lee M, Yang J, Park S, Jo EK, Kim HY, Bae YS, Windisch MP

Literature.Title: The macrocyclic peptide antibiotic micrococcin P(1) is secreted by the food-borne bacterium Staphylococcus equorum WS 2733 and inhibits Listeria monocytogenes on soft cheese.
Literature.Author: Carnio MC, Höltzel A, Rudolf M, Henle T, Jung G, Scherer S

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv(MIC=>20µM),Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv (RM1)(MIC=1.25µM),Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv(80-90% Inhibition=1µM),Human hepatocellular carcinoma HepG2(0-10% Inhibition=30µM),Human acute monocytic leukemia THP-1(0-10% Inhibition=30µM),Hepatitis C virus (HCV)(IC50 I=0.80±0.28µM),Hepatitis C virus (HCV) PsV(IC50 E=0.16±0.08µM),Human hepatocellular carcinoma Huh-7.5.1 cells(50-60% Cytotoxicity=11.5±0.14µM),Salmonella sp.(no activity data),Citrobacter freundii(no activity data),Enterococcus faecalis(no activity data),Escherichia coli(no activity data),Yersinia enterocolitica(no activity data),Pseudomonas sp.(no activity data)
